definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: shake, shake out or off (NH [[נׇעַר]] shake, stir up, esp. Pi. Niph.; Targum [[נְעׂרֶת]] tow (v. infr.); Ar. nagira, nagara boil, be in violent commotion, be very angry);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 1 S. [[נׇעַ֫רְתִּי]] Ne 5:13; Pt. act. [[נׁעֵר]] Is 33:9, Is 33:15; pass. Ne 5:13; —shake out, to shew emptiness, ´[[חָחְנִי נ]] Ne 5:13 (symbol.), [[כַּפָּיו מִתְּמׂח בַּשּׁׂחַד]] ´[[נ]] Is 33:15; pt. shaken out, emptied [[וׇרֵק]] ´[[נ]] Ne 5:13 (i.e. stripped of possessions); shake off (leaves) Is 33:9 (cf. ‖ cl.).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. 1 S. [[נַנְעַ֫רְתִּי כָאַרְבֶּה]] Ps 109:23 I am shaken out like a locust (fr. fold of a garment; sim. of perishing helplessly); cf. Impf. 3 mpl. [[וְיִנׇּֽעֲרוּ רְשָׁעִים מִמֶָּנׇּה]] Job 38:13 to seize the corners of the earth that wicked men may be shaken out of it; 1 S. [[אִנׇּעֵר]] Ju Jdg 16:20 I will shake myself (free ? cf. Hithp. and GFM).

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. juss. [[יְנַעֵר]] Ne 5:13 so may God shake utterly out every man from ([[מִן]]) his house, etc.; [[וַיְנַעֵר]] Ex 14:27 and ´[[י]] shook off the Egypt. into ([[ב]]) the sea, = Pf. [[נִעֵר]] Ps 136:15 (also c. acc. + [[ב]]).

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Imv. fs. [[הִתְנַעֲרִי מֵעָפָר]] Is 52:2 shake thyself (free), etc. (of personif. Zion).
